result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlin J Steller Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sheboygan County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Not to possess any dangerous weapons

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional and take all medicine as prescribed
Not to be in the company  on anyone in possession of illegal drugs
  No contact directly or indirectly with the victim or residence unless approved by the agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
